thread.title: South Sudan starts unlikely quest to reach 2018 World Cup
thread.title_full: South Sudan starts unlikely quest to reach 2018 World Cup

title: South Sudan starts unlikely quest to reach 2018 World Cup
text:
South Sudan and other minnows start unlikely quests to reach 2018 World Cup in Russia THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   2:33   2:34   
Subjects: 
Africa (700) 

KAMPALA, Uganda â€” A month after celebrating its first win in a competitive game, South Sudan will make its debut in World Cup qualifying on Wednesday as Africa's lowest-ranked countries begin their quests to reach soccer's biggest tournament. 
South Sudan only gained independence in 2011, joined the Confederation of African Football and FIFA in 2012, and achieved its biggest moment to date last month by beating Equatorial Guinea in an African Cup qualifier. 
The team could make more history against Mauritania in their two-leg 2018 World Cup qualifying tie. Although itself a minnow, Mauritania is ranked 55 places higher than South Sudan on FIFA's list. 
Without any star players, South Sudan coach Lee Sung-jea urged fans to pack the stadium in Juba and make the difference against Mauritania in Wednesday's first leg.
